Balbus appears to have written some work on the history of his times, for Suetonius (Caes. 77) quotes some remarks of Caesar's from a work of T. Ampius..." from Smith's Dictionary of Greek and Roman Biography and Mythology, Vol 1, 1867, p. 455.

"Ampius Balbus, T., tribunus plebis 63 BC (Vell. Pat. 2,40,4), praetor 59, finally procos. in Asia (MRR 2, 197). After his return he was an unsuccessful candidate for the consulate in 55 (schol. Bob. 156St.), in the Civil War he fought on the side of Pompey ( Pompeius)....l also appears as a historian (Cic. Fam. 6,12, 5) and published after Caesar's death a work in which he attacked him sharply (Suet. Iul. 77)...:" from Will, Wolfgang (Bonn). "Ampius." Brill's New Pauly.
